snippet: Former Representative Robert K. Dornan has declared himself a candidate in 1998 so he can continue contesting his loss in last year's election, his lawyer said today.    Mr. Dornan, a conservative Republican who served nine terms, has said that vo...
lead_paragraph: Former Representative Robert K. Dornan has declared himself a candidate in 1998 so he can continue contesting his loss in last year's election, his lawyer said today. Mr. Dornan, a conservative Republican who served nine terms, has said that voter fraud led to his 984-vote defeat by Representative Loretta Sanchez. Mr. Dornan had urged Congress to throw out the results and call a special election this year.
abstract: Former Rep Robert K Dornan, who narrowly lost Congressional seat from California to Rep Loretta Sanchez, declares himself 1998 candidate; says he acts so that he can accept campaign contributions in continuing battle to have Congress throw out results (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Dornan to Make Bid To Reclaim House Seat
